intro: Lepigonum anceps var. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular lepigonum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a hairy texture, and the plant produces small, triangular fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
